documents.document: Ontario update 8/8 Rule of thumb, for everyone: outside either (a) 2m distance or (b) mask. #COVID19Ontario https://t.co/SvKXliScOu https://t.co/4bu0rxNYGv
Ontario update 7/8 Even better news (though just a start); More vaccine is starting to get to the places that need it most. #COVID19Ontario https://t.co/SvKXliScOu https://t.co/LbCmbs1iaq
Ontario update 6/8 Good news: First dose vaccination is expanding. #COVID19Ontario https://t.co/SvKXliScOu https://t.co/hTrePBgOK1

Ontario update 5/8 Ontario hospitals are transferring more patients to other centres sometimes very far away from family than ever before. #COVID19Ontario https://t.co/SvKXliScOu https://t.co/2Yy4KHKA9Z

Ontario update 4/8 ICUs are under incredible pressure theyre still rising, even as hospitalizations crest. Were backlogged 257,536 surgeries. We cant deal with the backlog, until ICUs start to clear up. #COVID19Ontario https://t.co/SvKXliScOu https://t.co/1WqwZJndIr

Ontario update 3/8 Combo of vaccine and public health measures is driving COVID down. Were close to Yellow now, Green would get us back to February numbers by late May but that means pushing down hard. #COVID19Ontario https://t.co/SvKXliScOu https://t.co/cBu9oOqGJD
Ontario update 2/8 Were moving around less great But too many of us are still going to work. #COVID19Ontario https://t.co/SvKXliScOu https://t.co/2wlurtzZob
Ontario update 1/8 The curve is cresting, but just This is a good start. We have to keep driving COVID19 down. #COVID19Ontario https://t.co/SvKXliScOu https://t.co/aXvYCBxgwA
Our current modelling, which we're now presenting at a news conference you can follow on CBC Newsnet, CP24, CTV News Channel and CPAC (to 4 p.m.) #COVID19Ontario https://t.co/5ZRt222XfH

We'll be presenting our updated modelling in a live press conference at 3 p.m. (Toronto time) today. You can see it at CPAC Canada Responds https://t.co/ez8M75OLs6, or your favourite news network... #COVID19Ontario

6/6 Ontario needs EFFECTIVE sick leave, because it's an ethical imperative. Doing this right can heal our communities, deepen trust between Ontarians those making decisions for us, and fight a disease that we all share but not equally. #COVID19Ontario https://t.co/9eoUF4FkLb

5/6 Ontario needs EFFECTIVE sick leave because the federal benefit pays too little, takes too long, runs too short has too much red tape France, Ireland, Australia, Spain, the US our Yukon cousins have more effective systems. #COVID19Ontario https://t.co/9eoUF4FkLb https://t.co/OAy0D1PJT8

4/6 Ontario needs EFFECTIVE sick leave because more than half (!!) of Ontarians must work onsite, often in jobs that have no sick benefit, pay less than $50k per year; so every single cheque counts. #COVID19Ontario https://t.co/9eoUF4FkLb https://t.co/JZEmNt34Ov

3/6 Ontario needs EFFECTIVE sick leave to end the Third Wave. Most of Ontarios outbreaks are at work. In the US, effective paid sick leave -- the Families First Coronavirus Response Act (FFCRA) actually cut COVID-19 spread in half. #COVID19Ontario https://t.co/9eoUF4FkLb https://t.co/Mh7OSQ5ShU

2/6 Ontario needs EFFECTIVE sick leave to protect employees businesses. It reduces absenteeism, increases productivity (by preventing workplace outbreaks) supports businesses especially sm biz w/ tight cash flow through COVID. #COVID19Ontario https://t.co/9eoUF4FkLb https://t.co/m3YFZEeVNE

1/6 Ontario needs EFFECTIVE sick leave. Looks like this: 1. You call your employer, 2. Employer keeps paying you (enough) 3. Government pays employer (fully) 4. You get better and go back to work. #COVID19Ontario https://t.co/9eoUF4FkLb https://t.co/lKa9R8FocA

This is an early, early sign -- we seem to be heading in the right direction. Rt for Variants of Concern (95% of our COVID now) are <1. It's 0.94 to be precise. We have a long (long) way to go, but this is the right start. #COVID19Ontario https://t.co/U6F16usw2A https://t.co/Rh1DKrZNRD

2/2 Two things fight COVID faster than vaccine: masking distancing. But a year+ in, its hard even harder to help the people around you stick to it. Behavioural Science offers an important guide to this critical work. #COVID19Ontario https://t.co/eB1PigZTjE

1/2 Were all in a position to help our neighbours, family, co-workers and friends stay safe from COVID. Our behavioural scientists have this guidance for shaping a safe environment where you work and play. #COVID19Ontario https://t.co/eB1PigZTjE

3/3 Focusing on hotspots protects all of us, because vaccines also stop transmission. When we immunize essential workers, we also protect everyone around them (and around them, and them, and so on...). #COVID19Ontario https://t.co/nDX9zsC2XM https://t.co/9gAMxLY5Wz

2/3 Just by targeting vaccines on hotspots, we can prevent 20% of SARS-CoV2 infections in folks 16-59 years old -- and 18% infections overall (!!). (This assumes 50% of our vaccines are for anyone aged 16+ in hotspots). #COVID19Ontario https://t.co/nDX9zsC2XM https://t.co/5jhkYTYHKC

1/3 Speeding up COVID-19 vaccination in hotspots and for essential workers will cut SARS-CoV2 infections, hospitalization, ICU admission and death. (Hotspotting is an effective way to target many essential workers.) #COVID19Ontario https://t.co/nDX9zsC2XM https://t.co/iOlPszjeoA
RT @OntariosDoctors: @Ontariosdoctors strongly support #COVID19 Science Advisory Tables way forward statement. #onhealth https://t.co/
RT @OntHospitalAssn: The six steps outlined by @COVIDSciOntario will require consistent and effective government policy and guidance, combi
RT @OntHospitalAssn: The OHA strongly supports these recommendations from Ontario's independent COVID-19 Science Advisory Table -- a clear,

Science Advisory Table statement: Ontario is now facing the most challenging health crisis of our time. If we want to bring #COVID19Ontario under control, protect our health system and reopen as quickly as possible, this is the way forward: https://t.co/xN7zHCWi10

Imp't for MDs administering #Tocilizumab in Ontario. It's in short supply; here are clinical guidelines on how to manage supply in clinic. Pls read share with colleagues. #COVID19Ontario https://t.co/cfUdSmKmKx
Age limits on Astra Zeneca have changed in Ontario. If you are eligible for AZ, PLS GET IT. (while supplies last, as they say.) #COVID19Ontario

7/7 But we can stop COVID much faster than vaccines can. Vacc takes weeks to work; staying home stops COVID in its tracks! COVID explodes when we move around. Please, please stay close to home. #COVID19Ontario https://t.co/eQ2lGrjLKG https://t.co/QnithG1VCz

6/7 The payoff from targeting our vaccines on those who need it most. Offering it younger, in targeted hotspots, almost doubles the effectiveness of vaccine. #COVID19Ontario https://t.co/eQ2lGrjLKG https://t.co/O3X2aXb5kG

5/7 Places that least need vaccine are still getting more than those that need it most. Ontario is working to change this, but we all have a part to play. Get it when its your turn, help others get it when its theirs, wait your turn. #COVID19Ontario https://t.co/eQ2lGrjLKG https://t.co/IgaZrD0jby
4/7 Please, get your vaccine now if its your turn; help others get theirs when its their turn; and please wait your turn. #COVID19Ontario https://t.co/eQ2lGrjLKG https://t.co/rsc8Alim1T

3/7 Were facing 18,000 DAILY new cases. This isnt a curve its Mum and Dad. Our daughters sons. The person you love most in your life. Every person has a family, a story, a future. We can still stop the very worst from happening. #COVID19Ontario https://t.co/eQ2lGrjLKG https://t.co/GRbjsWZzgG
2/7 Notice this, please. Ontarios hospitals, YOUR hospitals some of the best in the world are cracking. #COVID19Ontario https://t.co/eQ2lGrjLKG https://t.co/LTmn8IElnA

1/7 COVID will keep growing exponentially as long as Rt>1. Were in that zone on both VOCs (now dominating in Ontario) and on the original. #COVID19Ontario https://t.co/eQ2lGrjLKG https://t.co/655thpu1qs

Hi everyone, sorry for the radio silence over the last few days -- we've been working... News conference today at 1 p.m. (Toronto time). Please join us here: https://t.co/sdWYCqjdn3 (or at most other Canadian news channels) #COVID19Ontario
Excellent all-in-one-page summary of clinical guidelines for COVID therapeutics. Clinicians: please read share w/ colleagues. #COVID19Ontario https://t.co/VQydJfNJrQ
Most of our homebound elderly live in Ontarios COVID hotspots. Heres a plan to bring vaccine to THEM. #COVID19Ontario https://t.co/2K89EsMwCt https://t.co/X8QfB0u5TP

More than 25% of Ontarians older than 75 havent even booked a vaccine appointment but most want it. The gap: Homebound elderly, who cant get to an appointment. Heres a plan to bring the vaccine to them. #COVID19Ontario https://t.co/2K89EsMwCt https://t.co/wwcWG05hgN

Third wave update -- we're focusing on Variants, which are now the main COVID in Ontario (B117 is so much more infectious, we may as well call it 'new COVID'): Rt of Variants is 1.25. They're now 67% of spread. #COVID19Ontario https://t.co/U6F16usw2A https://t.co/3pjEcUMGHS
For ED inpatient health professionals: More clinical guidance on Astra Zeneca related clotting: pls read share with colleagues https://t.co/Muz0lVBLlh
For outpatient health professionals: More clinical guidance on rare cases of Astra Zeneca related clotting. pls read share w/ colleagues #COVID19Ontario https://t.co/TwFXSIphIh
The Payoff 3/3: Saving schools! This is so important. Hitting this third wave hard will protect our schools, and our kids. #COVID19Ontario https://t.co/WO1Q8CGGWR https://t.co/p9rN0mvjMg
The payoff 2/3. If Ontario hits back hard NOW, we save our health care system. (Green Line). #COVID19Ontario https://t.co/WO1Q8CGGWR https://t.co/e0UBTJdx1Q
The Payoff 1/3. If Ontario hits back hard NOW, we bounce back sooner (green line). #COVID19Ontario https://t.co/WO1Q8CGGWR https://t.co/leWWsDV6Tz
Todays briefing final thread: The Payoff (in three parts) #COVID19Ontario https://t.co/WO1Q8CGGWR

What we can do now 4/4: Spend time OUTSIDE with friends / family. 2m apart; masked if you have to be closer. (Dr. COVIDSciOn does 2m in a park w/ friends. Works nicely for coffee losing at badminton not so good for chess, admittedly.) #COVID19Ontario https://t.co/WO1Q8CGGWR https://t.co/8HVuIBZPtE

What we can do now 3/4. Get vaccine into the highest risk neighbourhoods. Highest risk areas are 1-3; for ages 80+ and below 60, theyre LESS vaccinated than lower risk areas (8-10), This hurts everyone. #COVID19Ontario https://t.co/WO1Q8CGGWR https://t.co/1RTZxSmd5v

What we can do now 2/4. Get your vaxx now, if you are eligible. And help others get theirs book their appointments, help them get there. Any vaccine that Ontario makes available to your group is safe for your group. #COVID19Ontario https://t.co/WO1Q8CGGWR https://t.co/Jbt4rGftZQ
What we can do now 1/4: Help essential workers stay home when they are sick. Workplace spread is a critical driver. #COVID19Ontario https://t.co/WO1Q8CGGWR https://t.co/wSdGfPqdra
Todays briefing Third thread: What we can do now (in four parts) #COVID19Ontario https://t.co/WO1Q8CGGWR
Understanding VOCs 2/2. Lets call it the new COVID: Hits younger #COVID19Ontario https://t.co/WO1Q8CGGWR https://t.co/quGEulUGcZ
Understanding VOCs 1/2 Lets call it the new COVID: causes more hospitalization, ICU death #COVID19Ontario https://t.co/WO1Q8CGGWR https://t.co/nkbG6FVAlL
Todays briefing -- second thread: Understanding VOCs (in two parts) #COVID19Ontario https://t.co/WO1Q8CGGWR
Our Third Wave 4/4 the longer this continues, the longer it will take to rebuild our health care system. #COVID19Ontario https://t.co/WO1Q8CGGWR https://t.co/pZ8py6mpIV
Our Third Wave 3/4: Our hospitals are getting slammed. #COVID19Ontario https://t.co/WO1Q8CGGWR https://t.co/LKZrSE7uhv
Our Third Wave 2/4: The provincial curve is climbing quickly. VOCs are 40% more contagious. #COVID19Ontario https://t.co/WO1Q8CGGWR https://t.co/QC4b0h8Sg1
Our Third Wave 1/4: VOCs are driving dramatic surge in SARS-CoV2 across the province. VOCs are 40% more contagious. #COVID19Ontario https://t.co/WO1Q8CGGWR https://t.co/CyBB9LFlqR
First thread: Our Third Wave (in four parts) #COVID19Ontario https://t.co/WO1Q8CGGWR

Were tweeting todays briefing a bit differently theres so much to share Four threads: (1) Our 3rd wave (2) Understanding VOCs (3) What we can do now (4) The Payoff #COVID19Ontario https://t.co/WO1Q8CGGWR

This. Is. Different. 7/7 Vaccines Work. If youre eligible, please get vaxxed NOW. If you know others who are eligible, help them make and keep appointments. Any vaccine approved by Health Canada is a good vaccine. #COVID19Ontario https://t.co/acV1xJooBj

This. Is. Different. 6/7. We CAN do more: BE OUTSIDE. Risks are far lower. If you can take it outside, pls do. While outside: stay 2m apart, mask if you need to be closer. (Always mask if you must meet or work w/ others inside). #COVID19Ontario https://t.co/acV1xJooBj

This. Is. Different. 5/7. Were not reacting the way we did before. We already have more ICU hospitalization than we did when we locked down in December off the same # of infections we had then. #COVID19Ontario https://t.co/acV1xJooBj https://t.co/kpdDPHnUkL

This. Is. Different. 4/7. This time we know exactly whats coming: VOC hits hardest 15-28 days after infection; Rising infections today are a clear map to more ICU and death within four weeks. #COVID19Ontario https://t.co/acV1xJooBj https://t.co/6BpchWn7dG

This. Is. Different 2/7. Ontario is in more danger than before. New data: VOC are now dominant and lead to 62% higher risk of hospitalization, 114% higher risk of ICU; 40% higher risk of death. #COVID19Ontario https://t.co/acV1xJooBj https://t.co/dlzJSKJX4A

This. Is. Different 3/7. COVID is hitting YOUNGER. New data: with VOCs now dominant, 46% of ICU admissions (March 15-21) were younger than 60. #COVID19Ontario https://t.co/acV1xJooBj https://t.co/66xomzGeqq

This. Is. Different. 1/7. Yes, weve been at this for a year; were exhausted; weve heard it all before. Today, our news is different. The situation is more serious. We also have options. Pls read these 7 tweets share. #COVID19Ontario https://t.co/acV1xJooBj

Were facing a tough moment. VOCs are 68% of our SARS-CoV2, ~1572 cases as of today; Rt = 1.36. Standby for a full report on VOCs here later this afternoon. #COVID19Ontario https://t.co/U6F16usw2A https://t.co/u8yQDGtbyT
Astra Zeneca benefits outweigh its risks. We have a good QA for non health professionals here. #COVID19Ontario https://t.co/CYSzPMfVFh
Astra Zeneca AE clinical guidelines: If youre a health professional (espy primary / emerg / pharmacy) pls take a moment to read share w/ colleagues. #COVID19Ontario https://t.co/ZX1lkbOptI

Ontarios pandemic today: VOC are an estimated 1042 new cases (first time above 1000. They account for 58% of the spread and have Rt of 1.28. Watch that orange line (below). #COVID19Ontario https://t.co/U6F16usw2A https://t.co/XPjulU4GmL

Ontarios Variants: Could this curve get any steeper?! Variants Rt is 1.25 (March 18) and theyre about 56% of Ontarios pandemic. This line is the message #COVID19Ontario https://t.co/U6F16usw2A https://t.co/3zTf8k2NPR

Great weather coming up this weekend (unless youre in Thunder Bay or Kenora; rainy Sunday, sorry). Get outside if you can be careful. Latest R on VOCs was 1.34. Variants now 54% of our SARS-CoV2, were approx 830 cases as of Thursday. #COVID19Ontario https://t.co/U6F16usw2A https://t.co/QNAdzT5w4T
Latest Rt for VOCs is 1.35. Todays estimated count of VOCs is 797 cases; 53% of the provinces SARS-CoV2. #COVID19Ontario https://t.co/U6F16usw2A https://t.co/o7Sa2QA8ek

Ontarios front line workers trace roots back to everywhere in the world, and deep into this territory. Wherever home is, this St Paddys Day message from our Irish friends may resonate. https://t.co/Ez1j8flEqc
3/3 We used open-source data to blueprint this for TO; any community in Ontario can develop the same plan. We offer some guidelines on how to do it. #COVID19Ontario https://t.co/dKyLmn3psl

2/3 Naturally Occurring Retirement Communities buildings that have many elderly residents, but arent LTC homes. We used open data to pinpoint 256 in TOs high-risk zones; home to 41k seniors. We can bring vaccine to them! #COVID19Ontario https://t.co/dKyLmn3psl https://t.co/hL855HxhNY

1/3 To beat COVID, we urgently need to vaccinate elderly Ontarians living in high-risk zones but may older people cant make it to a clinic. Heres how Ontario can bring the vaccine to them! #COVID19Ontario https://t.co/dKyLmn3psl https://t.co/orM7EPW7QE

Your daily R VOC update: Rt on VOCs was 1.38 March 12 (takes a couple of days to calculate because math). VOCs are now ~53% of SARS-CoV2 in Ontario; that's estimated 778 cases. https://t.co/MN2BxNW43b

Sadly, we are in fact all in this together. Ontario is organized into 34 public health units; almost two-thirds are now experiencing exponential growth of SARS-CoV2. #COVID19Ontario https://t.co/U6F16usw2A https://t.co/gjmYYKPY5b

So, here we are: Ontario's Third Wave. This isnt a model.. Blue line is overall SARS-CoV2 spread; Orange line is VOCs -- now almost half of the pandemic and driving the growth. (The two lines are now parallel). #COVID19Ontario https://t.co/U6F16usw2A https://t.co/i8hcod9XAo

Tough news for today: 733 daily cases of Variants of Concern = 49% of all COVID in Ontario. Yes, spring is here; yes, vaccines are coming; yes, weve been fighting for a long time but this is NOT over yet. Stay safe til its safe. #COVID19Ontario https://t.co/U6F16usw2A https://t.co/HuGfeJ6B4J
This variants of concern curve is getting close to vertical. Yes, vaccines are coming but we are NOT out of this yet. #COVID19Ontario https://t.co/U6F16usw2A https://t.co/j58HNkmzda

1.41 Thats the current estimate for Rt (effective transmission rate) with variants of concern. 1.41. The early variants are back above 1 too. Both well up from last week. Were heading in the wrong direction, Ontario. #COVID19Ontario https://t.co/U6F16usw2A https://t.co/9xmRGdTB9C
COVID Update 7/7: Our behaviour is key too Stay Close To Home! ("Our blue line isn't looking great, IMHO," says Dr. COVIDSciON) #COVID19Ontario https://t.co/NcCK6nQO8I https://t.co/DZQgwhidzA
COVID Update 6/7: Vaccines protect more than just you; evidence from Israel is that they also stop spread. (This is a big deal!!) #COVID19Ontario https://t.co/NcCK6nQO8I https://t.co/q6R18kjjCD

COVID Update 5/7: Vaccine speed is key: PLS get one as soon as youre eligible!! More than 1m Ontarians already have at least one dose. Chk your hospital / pharmacy / municipality / health unit. #COVID19Ontario https://t.co/NcCK6nQO8I https://t.co/ybqnf4OmRT
COVID Update 4/7: just when we need hospitals most #COVID19Ontario https://t.co/NcCK6nQO8I https://t.co/3o9zTH4vhc
COVID Update 3/7: which would slam our hospitals (YELLOW again) #COVID19Ontario https://t.co/NcCK6nQO8I https://t.co/Ln9EGFNZcj
COVID Update 2/7: And this new pandemic could get bad (check out the YELLOW line) #COVID19Ontario https://t.co/NcCK6nQO8I https://t.co/tRIIP68If7
COVID update 1/7: New variants are creating a new pandemic (look at the red chart) #COVID19Ontario https://t.co/NcCK6nQO8I https://t.co/j4BWpPArAN

The best evidence that we can turn the curve on Variants? We've done it before! (This is what we've done to the early COVID variants, which now account for ~58% of the virus in Ontario.) #COVID19Ontario https://t.co/U6F16usw2A https://t.co/XZrCVKu3UV

If you check the Leafs / Sens scores every day, dont do that itll drive you nuts. Check this instead: you CAN do more about Rt than about bad penalty kills. Distance, mask, stay home if youre sick. Push Rt on VOCs to below 1!! #COVID19Ontario https://t.co/U6F16usw2A https://t.co/nbkBAKdmdr

Rt is the effective reproduction number how many additional infections one infected person causes. It's 1.24 now on VOCs, but changes constantly based on our actions immunity. We need to get this below 1 by distancing ( masking). #COVID19Ontario https://t.co/U6F16usw2A

Were now publishing Rt how fast COVID is spreading in Ontario every day. Check this like youd check the weather. (Except this isnt a forecast. It's real.) We need to get below 1 to stop the spread. Today were at 1.24 on VOCs. #COVID19Ontario https://t.co/U6F16usw2A https://t.co/MNqkrh1NaA

Our LTC findings show how important it is to first vaccinate populations who have especially high risk of SARS-CoV-2 infection, COVID-19 hospitalization and death. Doing this the right way will save more Ontarians, more quickly. #COVID19Ontario https://t.co/1BVhNiRz76

AND -- this is important vaccines work best in the context of public health measures, until the whole population has vaccine-based immunity. So we have to keep our guard up while we roll out vaccine! . #COVID19Ontario https://t.co/1BVhNiRz76
Data show dramatic drop in death by COVID in Long Term Care homes. A sign of how powerful these vaccines are. #COVID19Ontario https://t.co/1BVhNiRz76 https://t.co/L4B2mVFIKQ

Bravo Ontario!! Deciding to target Long Term Care homes for the first COVID-19 vaccines substantially reduced infections, hospitalizations, deaths among LTC residents and health care workers. #COVID19Ontario https://t.co/1BVhNiRz76
RT @jyangstar: NEW: The province is taking the Science Table's advice to prioritize vaccines based on age *and* area. My story last week
